definitions: point or place where something begins or is created
person's social background or ancestry
examples: Scientists debate the origin of the universe
The river's origin lies in the mountains
She was proud of her Irish origins
His humble origins didn't prevent his success

definitions: person aged between thirteen and nineteen years
examples: The program is designed specifically for teens
Many teens struggle with identity issues

definitions: outer garment worn outdoors, having sleeves and extending below hips
thin layer or covering of something
examples: She wore a thick winter coat
His coat was hanging in the closet
Apply a second coat of paint tomorrow
The pills have a special protective coat

definitions: tall narrow building or structure, typically taller than its diameter
examples: The church tower is visible from miles away
They climbed to the top of the observation tower

definitions: official document giving permission to own or do something
examples: She finally got her driver's license
The restaurant's liquor license expired last month

definitions: social media platform for sharing short messages called tweets
examples: The news broke first on Twitter
She has thousands of followers on Twitter

definitions: subjects comprising a course of study in school or college
examples: The school revised its science curriculum
Computer programming was added to the curriculum

definitions: system for sending letters and packages
letters and packages conveyed by postal system
examples: The mail is delivered at noon
International mail takes longer to arrive
She received three pieces of mail today
Check the mail for my package

definitions: approximate calculation or judgment of value, number, quantity, or extent
examples: The contractor gave an estimate for repairs
Current estimates put the crowd at ten thousand

definitions: capacity to gain accurate and deep understanding of someone or something
examples: Her insights into human behavior were remarkable
The study provides new insights into climate change

definitions: person who carries out formal inquiry or examination
examples: Private investigators worked on the case
The lead investigator interviewed all witnesses

definitions: microscopic organism that causes disease in living hosts
malicious computer program that replicates itself
examples: The flu virus spreads quickly in winter
Scientists are studying the new virus strain
Her computer was infected with a virus
The virus deleted important system files

definitions: severe tropical cyclone with winds exceeding seventy-four miles per hour
examples: The hurricane caused massive flooding along the coast
Residents evacuated before the hurricane arrived

definitions: action of providing or supplying something for use
condition or requirement in legal document
examples: They made provision for emergency supplies
The provision of clean water is essential
The contract includes a provision for early termination
This provision protects consumer rights

definitions: organized refusal to work as form of protest
act of hitting forcefully
examples: Workers went on strike for better wages
The strike lasted for three weeks
The lightning strike damaged the building
A lucky strike in bowling knocked down all pins

definitions: structure consisting of upright and transverse piece
place where two things intersect
examples: A wooden cross stood atop the church
She wore a small gold cross
Be careful at the railroad cross
The accident happened at a busy cross

definitions: short coat extending to waist or hips
examples: He zipped up his leather jacket
The suit jacket needed alterations

definitions: color between blue and yellow in spectrum
area of grass, especially in center of town
examples: The leaves turned from green to yellow
She painted the walls a soft green
Children played on the village green
The golf green was perfectly maintained

definitions: money paid for work or services
examples: His monthly pay covers all expenses
The workers demanded higher pay

definitions: conclusion that can be drawn from something not explicitly stated
likely consequence of something
examples: She understood the implication of his words
The implication was clear without being stated
Consider the implications of this decision
The financial implications are significant

definitions: literature describing imaginary events and people
examples: She prefers fiction to non-fiction books
His latest work of fiction became a bestseller

definitions: organized public demonstration expressing strong objection to policy or action
examples: Thousands joined the protest against war
The peaceful protest lasted all day

definitions: informal word for mother
examples: The baby called for her mama
Mama always made the best cookies

definitions: one of two children born at same birth
one of a matching pair
examples: The twins look exactly alike
She has a twin brother
The city has a twin in France
These buildings are architectural twins

definitions: garment covering body from waist to ankles with separate leg portions
examples: He wore dark pants to the interview
These pants need to be hemmed

definitions: sudden upsetting or surprising experience or event
acute medical condition from severe injury or trauma
examples: The news came as a complete shock
The shock of losing her job was overwhelming
The patient went into shock after the accident
Doctors treated him for shock

definitions: principles or standards by which something is judged or decided
examples: The selection criteria include academic performance
These criteria must be met for approval

definitions: object for children to play with
examples: The child's favorite toy was a stuffed bear
They donated toys to the children's hospital

definitions: physical attack or threat of violence against someone
examples: He was charged with assault and battery
The assault occurred late at night

definitions: pointed top of mountain or highest point of something
examples: They reached the mountain peak at sunrise
Sales hit their peak in December

definitions: strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility
examples: His anger was evident in his voice
She struggled to control her anger

definitions: sturdy item of footwear covering foot and ankle
storage compartment of car
examples: She wore hiking boots on the trail
His work boots were covered in mud
Put the groceries in the boot
The spare tire is in the boot

definitions: person of same age, status, or ability as another
examples: She earned respect from her peers
Peer pressure influences teenage behavior

definitions: abstract science of number, quantity, and space
examples: She excelled at math in school
The math problem required careful calculation

definitions: act of kindness beyond what is due or usual
approval, support, or liking for someone or something
examples: Could you do me a favor?
She returned the favor later
The decision was made in his favor
Public opinion shifted in favor of reform

definitions: fine dry powder consisting of tiny particles of matter
examples: Dust covered the old furniture
The wind kicked up clouds of dust

definitions: sister of one's father or mother or wife of uncle
examples: My aunt lives in California
She visited her favorite aunt every summer

definitions: possibility or likelihood of future success
person regarded as potential customer or candidate
examples: The prospect of rain cancelled the picnic
Job prospects have improved this year
The salesman contacted several new prospects
She's a good prospect for the position

definitions: temporary state of mind or feeling
examples: Her mood improved after the good news
The rainy weather affected everyone's mood

definitions: official agreement ending a dispute
place where people establish community
examples: They reached a settlement out of court
The divorce settlement was finalized
The early settlement grew into a town
Archaeological evidence of ancient settlements

definitions: distance from top or surface to bottom
complexity and profundity of thought
examples: The pool's depth is eight feet
Divers explored the ocean depths
Her analysis showed great depth
The book lacks depth of character

definitions: liquid obtained from or present in fruit or vegetables
examples: She drank fresh orange juice every morning
The recipe calls for lemon juice

definitions: room or building for displaying works of art
balcony or upper floor projecting from back or side wall
examples: The art gallery featured local artists
They visited every gallery in the district
Spectators filled the gallery above
The church gallery held the choir

definitions: mental or emotional strain
state of being stretched tight
examples: Tension filled the room during negotiations
Family tensions increased during the holidays
The rope's tension needs adjustment
Muscle tension causes headaches

definitions: passage from back of mouth to stomach and lungs
examples: She had a sore throat all week
The doctor examined his throat carefully

definitions: preliminary version of piece of writing
current of cool air in room or confined space
examples: She completed the first draft of her novel
The draft needs major revisions
Close the window to stop the draft
A cold draft came under the door

definitions: beliefs or opinions generally held about someone or something
examples: The scandal damaged his reputation
The restaurant has an excellent reputation

definitions: alphabetical list of topics with references
indicator, sign, or measure of something
examples: Check the index for specific topics
The book's index was very detailed
The consumer price index rose slightly
Stock market indexes showed gains

definitions: state of confusion and disorderliness
situation that is confused or full of problems
examples: The kitchen was a complete mess
Clean up this mess immediately
The project became a financial mess
They inherited a political mess

definitions: feeling of great pleasure and happiness
examples: Her face showed pure joy
The birth brought joy to the family
